item.title: 大规模杀伤性武器是如何受到 ESG 投资者青睐的？
item.description:
欧洲后院战火纷飞，欧洲领导人不希望任何环境、社会和公司治理方面的顾虑妨碍他们引导私人资本投入足以抵御俄罗斯的军事威慑力量。【原文：

With war raging in its backyard, Europe’s leaders don’t want any ESG qualms to get in the way of steering private capital into a military deterrent strong enough to resist Russia.

】

item.title: 雷蒙德-梅森（Raymond Mason），美盛基金经理创始人，享年 88 岁
item.description: 雷蒙德-"奇普"-梅森（Raymond "Chip" Mason）去世，他在过去 40 年中通过收购将自己的美盛公司发展成为美国最大的资金管理公司之一。享年 88 岁。【原文：Raymond “Chip” Mason, who expanded his firm, Legg Mason Inc., through acquisitions over four decades into one of the largest money managers in the US, has died. He was 88.】

item.title: <strong>俄勒冈州和加利福尼亚州野火蔓延，引发疏散</strong
item.description: 加利福尼亚州葡萄酒之乡和俄勒冈州中部的野火一夜之间蔓延开来，导致数百人撤离，消防员周日在干燥、炎热的天气中努力控制火势。【原文：Wildfires in California wine country and Central Oregon grew overnight, prompting hundreds of evacuations as firefighters worked Sunday to try to contain the blazes amid dry, hot weather.】

item.title: 南非工会签署高于通胀的汽车行业工资协议
item.description: 南非最大的工会代表其汽车行业的 90,000 名会员签署了一份高于通胀率的加薪协议。【原文：South Africa’s largest union has signed an above-inflation wage increase on behalf of its 90,000 members in the motor industry.】

item.title: 意大利副总理称意大利不应向银行征收暴利税
item.description: 意大利副总理表示，他反对对银行征收暴利税，这个话题一直是乔治亚-梅洛尼领导的政府所面临的分歧问题。【原文：Italy’s deputy prime minister said he’s against imposing windfall taxes on banks, a topic that’s been a divisive issue for the government led by Giorgia Meloni.】

item.title: 卡扎克称欧洲央行可在利率保持良好的情况下观察经济
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克（Martins Kazaks）表示，欧洲中央银行已经进入了一个新的货币政策阶段，官员们可以专注于监控经济，而不是积极干预以改变经济走势。【原文：The European Central Bank has entered a new monetary-policy phase where officials can focus on monitoring the economy rather than actively intervening to change its course, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 拉加德称中央银行的独立性至关重要
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）警告说，不要质疑政策制定者及其机构的独立性，她认为，如果政府参与制定利率，经济就有可能出现功能失调。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned against questioning the independence of policymakers and their institutions, arguing that economies risk becoming dysfunctional if governments get involved in setting interest rates.】

item.title: 鲍威尔引发的债券市场大反弹需要支持性数据来继续推进
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔周五表示，美联储最快将在下个月恢复降息，这令美国债券市场上涨。【原文：Jerome Powell sent the US bond market up on Friday by telegraphing his Federal Reserve will resume reducing interest rates as soon as next month.】

item.title: 美联储杰克逊霍尔会议揭示中央银行家的艰难前路
item.description: 美联储在落基山举行的年度聚会通常是央行行长们和他们的古怪朋友们放松身心、讨论一些复杂的经济话题，然后在大提顿山的阴影下远足的时候。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s annual gathering in the Rocky Mountains is usually a time for central bankers and their wonky friends to kick back, discuss a few complicated economic topics and then go for a hike in the shadow of Grand Teton.】

item.title: 华尔街青睐香草期权而非 VIX 期权来套期保值
item.description: 由于杰罗姆-鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔的讲话激起了人们对美联储将在 9 月降息的热情，套期保值再次成为热门话题，使股市回升至历史高点附近。【原文：Hedging is a hot topic again as Jerome Powell’s Jackson Hole speech stoked enthusiasm that the Federal Reserve will cut rates in September, sending stocks back up near record highs.】

item.title: 英伟达财报是美联储反弹后的股市风险事件
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示降息即将到来后，交易员们在本周的交易中松了一口气。股市的下一个考验将是对过去几年推动股市上涨的因素的解读：人工智能的兴奋。【原文：Traders are breathing easier heading into this week after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated that interest rate cuts are coming. The next test for the stock market will be a read on what’s been driving gains for the past few years: artificial intelligence euphoria.】

item.title: 基金称新兴资产将超越发达资产
item.description: 基金经理们表示，自美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 4 月份发动关税闪电战以来，新兴市场资产的回报率将领先于发达市场资产。【原文：Fund managers say returns on emerging-market assets are set to power head of their developed peers, having moved in lockstep since US President Donald Trump unleashed his tariff blitz in April.】

item.title: 苹果启动三年计划重塑标志性 iPhone
item.description: 苹果公司还有几周就要举行盛大的产品发布会了，届时它将为新一代 iPhone 的全面革新奠定基础。此外：该公司与谷歌洽谈使用 Gemini 为 Siri 提供动力，并提高了 TV+ 的价格。最后，苹果又失去了一位人工智能高管。【原文：Apple is weeks away from its big product launch event, where it will lay the foundation for a once-in-a-generation iPhone overhaul. Also: The company talks with Google about using Gemini to power Siri, and it raises the price of TV+. Lastly, Apple loses yet another AI executive to Meta.】

item.title: 尽管业界反对，菲律宾互联网法案仍成为法律
item.description: 尽管遭到菲律宾最大电话公司的反对，但一项旨在通过促进竞争加强菲律宾互联网连接的法案已成为法律。【原文：A bill aimed at enhancing internet connectivity in the Philippines by promoting competition has become law despite opposition from the country’s largest phone companies.】

item.title: 卡尼访问乌克兰，加拿大考虑派兵协助维和行动
item.description: 马克-卡尼首次以加拿大总理的身份访问乌克兰，他的政府表示可能准备加入由欧洲盟国领导的维和行动。【原文：Mark Carney is visiting Ukraine for the first time as Canada’s prime minister, as his government says it may be prepared to join peacekeeping efforts led by European allies.】

item.title: CSIS 称越南在南海加紧岛礁建设
item.description: 一家美国智库称，越南今年在南中国海有争议的南沙群岛大幅加快了造岛步伐。【原文：Vietnam has sharply accelerated its island-building efforts this year in the contested Spratly Islands in the South China Sea, a US think thank said.】

item.title: 新加坡附近的马来西亚州发生两次轻微地震
item.description: 马来西亚柔佛州是一个重要的数据中心枢纽，周日上午该州发生了两次轻微地震。【原文：The Malaysian state of Johor, a key data center hub, was hit by two mild earthquakes Sunday morning with early reports saying there were no casualties and little damage.】

item.title: 中国股市牛市不惧经济忧虑，泡沫风险与日俱增
item.description: 中国经济在关税和根深蒂固的房地产危机的重压下举步维艰，但股市却在延续牛市走势；这种脱节现象引发了人们对股市涨势持久力的怀疑。【原文：China’s economy is buckling under the weight of tariffs and a deep-rooted property crisis, yet stocks are extending their bull run — a disconnect that’s stirring doubts on the rally’s staying power.】

item.title: 热带风暴 "费尔南德 "不会对美国或加拿大构成威胁
item.description: 美国国家飓风中心周六表示，热带风暴费尔南在距离百慕大数百英里的大西洋公海上形成，预计将错过陆地。【原文：Tropical Storm Fernand formed in the open Atlantic Ocean hundreds of miles from Bermuda and is forecast to miss land, the US National Hurricane Center said on Saturday.】

item.title: 塞内加尔联盟敦促审计和取消未报告债务
item.description: 一个由立法者、经济学家和民间团体组成的联盟呼吁进行审计，以确定是否应取消以前未报告的 70 亿美元债务，理由是人们担心这些借款会对塞内加尔的财政造成压力。【原文：A coalition of lawmakers, economists and civil groups called for an audit to determine whether $7 billion in previously unreported debt should be canceled, citing concerns over the strain the borrowing places on Senegal’s finances.】

item.title: 鲍威尔转向就业市场，美国通胀将走高
item.description: 上个月，美国的一个关键通胀指标可能有所上升，这凸显了美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔和他的同事们在平衡物价上涨和脆弱的就业市场中不断增加的风险方面所面临的挑战。【原文：A key US inflation gauge probably ticked higher last month, underscoring the challenge Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and his colleagues face in balancing rising prices and mounting risks in a fragile job market.】

item.title: 美联储杰克逊霍尔年会的重要启示
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行在怀俄明州杰克逊霍尔举办的年度经济研讨会已接近尾声。【原文：The Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City’s annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyoming is winding down.】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利称英国面临提高潜在增长率的挑战
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，只要劳动力参与率仍然疲软，英国就面临着提高基本经济增长率的 "严峻挑战"。【原文：Britain faces an “acute challenge” to raise its underlying rate of economic growth as long as participation in the workforce remains weak, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said.】

item.title: 日本央行上田称女性和外籍劳工可帮助填补劳动力缺口
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，让更多女性从事全职工作，雇用更多外国工人，有助于解决日本人口老龄化和低出生率造成的劳动力紧张问题。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said bringing more women into full-time jobs and employing more foreign workers could help address the labor squeeze created by Japan’s aging population and low birth rate.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称劳动力市场很好地抵御了近期冲击
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，面对一代人中仅有一次的通胀冲击和咄咄逼人的加息，欧洲劳动力市场表现出了令人惊讶的韧性。【原文：Europe’s labor market has proved surprisingly resilient in the face of a once-in-a-generation inflation shock and aggressive interest-rate hikes, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.】

item.title: 信贷助推人工智能繁荣— 以及对泡沫的担忧
item.description: 信贷投资者正向人工智能投资投入数十亿美元，而行业高管和分析师们却在质疑这项新技术是否正在催生另一个泡沫。【原文：Credit investors are pouring billions of dollars into artificial intelligence investments, just as industry executives and analysts are raising questions about whether the new technology is inflating another bubble.】

item.title: 美国债务与 GDP 的比率达到 250% 不会推高利率：杰克逊霍尔文件
item.description: 美联储杰克逊霍尔会议上发表的一篇论文称，美国政府债务可能达到国内生产总值的 250%，而不会对利率造成上行压力。【原文：US government debt could reach 250% of gross domestic product without putting upward pressure on interest rates, according to a paper presented at the Federal Reserve’s Jackson Hole conference.】

item.title: 烧毁杰富瑞的 "庞氏骗局 "之水，每个人都能从中受益，直到它无法受益
item.description:
一家自动售货机企业曾标榜回报丰厚、超级安全，如今却成为联邦检察官和愤怒的投资者的纠缠不清的诉讼目标。【原文：

A vending-machine venture that once touted juicy, super-safe returns is now the target of federal prosecutors and a tangle of lawsuits by angry investors who say they were duped.

】

item.title: 默茨称应对德国经济困境比预期艰难
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）说，事实证明，应对国家经济挑战是一项远比他最初预计的要艰巨得多的任务。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said tackling the country’s economic challenges is proving to be a far greater undertaking than he initially anticipated.】

item.title: 美国共和党议员力推关税政策以帮助本土企业
item.description: 国会共和党人正在支持唐纳德-特朗普的关税运动，将其作为推进本州事业的一种方式，游说总统征收更多进口关税，以保护本地公司。【原文：Congressional Republicans are embracing Donald Trump’s tariff campaign as a way to advance home-state causes, lobbying the president to impose more import duties to protect local companies.】
